ygData.subject: Introduction to Berserk 7...
ygData.msgSnippet: Techy, Sky Knight, and Berserk walked down the streets at the eastern section. There were bots staring and some ducked for cover. It was all from Berserk s

Subject: Introduction to Berserk 7...
Message-ID: <8r3ir1+t2dm@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 4283
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: wilddance_mare@...

Techy, Sky Knight, and Berserk walked down the streets at the eastern 
section. There were bots staring and some ducked for cover. It was 
all from Berserk's presence. He had to aggressive posture or mood 
about him. He kept quiet and walked by the two scientists.

"Primus, they're so rude down here," Techy commented. Berserk turned 
his head down to look at her. She was closest to him. 

They made it to the weapons shop without incident. Bersek paused when 
Sky Knight led the way in. Techy gave him a reasuring tug, and he 
followed. There were racks of rifles, many styles of guns behind a 
glass case, swords stacked up on more racks, and boxed dentionators.

"Let's see," Techy said. "Try looking for a rifle first." 

"A big one," Sky Knight put in.

With Berserk at her side, Techy reached up and took a large rifle 
with a yellow tassle below the nozzle. It was a plasma rifle. She 
handed it to Berserk. He took it, wrapping the shoulder strap around 
his shoulder and held it accordingly. He jerked it, testing the 
weight.

He removed it and nodded in it's approval.

"Hey, a Wire Catcher," Sky Knight said by the front desk. "Didn't he 
have one of these?"

Berserk and Techy looked over. "Uh, I don't know." she said. Berserk 
walked to him.

"I did. I made my escapes that way." Berserk said. 

"You need one?" Sky Knight asked.

"I could."

There were three styles of the Wire Catchers, which was a devise that 
went around the forearm, containing a wire with a arrow-like head on 
the end. He picked up and largest one and fitted it on his right 
forearm. He checked the bottons on it. It had a shorter wire length 
than his old one. 

"Not the same model," he said. "It would have to do." He removed it 
and handed it to Sky Knight.

"Two hand-held guns," Sky Knight said.

"Then a clash sword would complete it," Techy added.

Berserk nodded.

Sky Knight bent down to the display case, looking at the many 
collection of hand gun sized energy weapons.

"Plasma blaster, model 5-E7," Berserk said, and Sky Knight 
immediately pointed to it. "And Stunner."

"Stunner, stunner." Sky Knight repeated, trying to find it. "Ah-ha!" 
He pointed to a white and blue gun with a smooth rounded off handle. 
It was a gun with a electric shock it to when he made contract to an 
opponet. "Hey, I know my weapons better than I thought." He stood up 
and looked around. "Now all we need is that clash sword." He left 
Berserk's side, walking to the rack of swords.

"I'm going to ask," Techy said, walking to the front desk. "Hello?" 
She looked around. "Anybody here?"

"I'm comming," a male voice called out and appeared from a room. A 
small bot walked to the desk, looking at Techy. "Yes?" He suddenly 
screamed, looking at Berserk. He ducked down behind the desk.

Techy scream from surprise and jumped back. Berserk jumped as well, 
and went into a defensive posure, setting his black hands in a curve.

"The heck?" Techy leaned over the desk, looking down at the bot 
hunched on the ground. "What is your problem?"

"Don't let him kill me!" he said.

"Huh?"

"That clone."

"Berserk?" She sneered. "He's got going to hurt you. Now get up. 
We're here only to do business."

He slowly stood up.

"We need a clash sword."

"Model C-7." Berserk said.

"I don't think we have anymore." the bot said nervously.

"Are you sure?" Techy asked.

"I don't know." He turned his head. "Hey, uh, Nova, we have anymore 
of those Clash swords? The E-7?"

"Yep, hey, we got one last one." a female's voice soon replied. "We 
got someone who wants it?"

"Uh, yeah." 

Within moments a female Predacon came out with a curving sword with 
several short chained blades in her hand. She placed it on the 
counter.

Techy nodded. "That it?" she asked.

"Yes," he replied. 

Techy put the rifle on the counter, then turned to Sky Knight. She 
waved to him. "We got it." He came to her side and placed to two gun 
with the other weapons. 

The small male rang up the credits, Sky Knight paying them. Both Sky 
Knight and Techy took their share of the weapons and walked to the 
doorway of the store.

Just as he stepped to the side, Berserk growled at the small bot. He 
screamed and ducked down.

His female partner pondered at the leaving giant, saying: "At least 
he has a sense of humor."
